conclusion: To find the magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the given wire segment in a uniform magnetic field.
The wire forms a right angle with segments ac and cd perpendicular to each other.
Segment ac has a length L and segment cd has a length 2L.
In a magnetic field perpendicular to the plane, segments parallel to the field do not contribute to the magnetic force.
Since segments ac and cd are perpendicular to each other, the net effect of the magnetic force can be treated by summing contributions from each segment.
Calculate the magnetic force on segment ac: F_ac = B * I * L.
Calculate the magnetic force on segment cd: F_cd = B * I * 2L.
Total force using Pythagorean theorem: F_total = sqrt(F_ac^2 + F_cd^2).
The magnitude of the Ampere force is B * I * L * sqrt(5).
